text:
Is there a way to use `@unpack`  even if the dict does not contain the key (and thereby replace it with a default value)?
```# Dictionary that contains info (e.g. from user-supplied input file)
	dict = Dict(:a => "newton", :b => "einstein", :c => "hawking")
	@unpack (a,b,d) = dict
ERROR: KeyError: key :d not found```
This arises because I am reading input from a file and the user may not set a parameter and when I @unpack I would like to default a value if it does not see it.
